The Board of Education approved the Reopen, Reimagine, Reengage Plan for South Lake Schools at the August 19th Regular Board of Education meeting. This plan allows for face-to-face instruction for elementary students and hybrid instruction for students in grades 6 - 12. For those families who do not want their child to attend any face-to-face instruction, a completely virtual option is also available. Please visit the South Lake Schools website for additional information regarding this plan and to learn more about online learning options at https://www.solake.org/

Please note that the Board of Education also decided that ALL students will begin the school year remotely. The Board will meet on September 23, 2020 to evaluate the current safety needs in the community and determine a date for students to attend school in person.

Technology Survey for Parents

The world for our children is changing at an incredible pace. In South Lake, we are taking steps to keep our students at the cutting edge of learning and trying to ensure that every student graduates from our schools with the skills they need to go out in the world and be successful. As part of those efforts, we are investigating the idea of equipping all students in grades 5 – 12 with a computing device that would allow them to learn and complete school work at their convenience. We are also planning on equipping elementary classrooms with a set of devices for use within the classroom.

As part of this effort, we are seeking some input from parents and the community in regard to perceptions around the use of technology in education and the technology resources available to students within their homes. We are asking that all parents of children in South Lake complete the following short survey so that we can better understand the needs within the community.
